personal.title: Software Engineer
personal.tagline: I enjoy working with scalable and distributed systems
personal.bio: I'm a tools developer and an avid learner with a passion for languages. I graduated from Army training in 2024 as an avionic mechanic and currently serve part time to focus on my career in software development. My work mostly involves distributed systems and full-stack development.

description: Developed software with C# that ran high-volume pharmaceutical workflows for different clients such as Publix
Work with our fulfillment solutions test team to track down bugs related to various systems, and to ensure the workflow is accurate from order submission to shipment of Rxs from the facility
Unit test, regression test, and patch validate for numerous app servers to ensure they match and satisfy customer needs
Travel to central-fill locations to train staff on our NEXiA software and troubleshoot any errors while going live
Interpreted schematics to diagnose electrical faults

projects.title: Distributed Task Processing System
projects.description: A scalable, production-ready distributed task processing system built with Go

projects.title: Fabric Nums
projects.description: Scientific and programmer visual calculator - Command Line w/ Rust

projects.title: 3D OpenGL Rendering Engine
projects.description: An OpenGL rendering experiment using modern OpenGL 3.3+

projects.title: LLA to ECEF Converter
projects.description: A coordinate conversion tool to get Earth-Centered, Earth-Fixed (ECEF) Cartesian coordinates from LLA coordinates.

military: B. CO. 1-222 AVN REGT Honor Graduate

posts.title: Building Scalable Systems: Lessons from Pharmaceutical Workflows
posts.excerpt: Exploring the challenges and solutions in developing high-volume pharmaceutical processing systems that handle millions of prescriptions daily.

posts.title: From Military Training to Software Development
posts.excerpt: How my experience as an avionic mechanic in the Army National Guard shaped my approach to problem-solving in software engineering.

posts.title: Implementing Custom Regex Engines: A Deep Dive
posts.excerpt: A technical exploration of building regex engines from scratch, covering finite automata, pattern matching algorithms, and performance optimization.

posts.title: Debugging Complex Systems: A Systematic Approach
posts.excerpt: Strategies and methodologies for troubleshooting complex software systems, drawn from both military and civilian experience.
